airhockeyjava.simulation

Class PuckSimulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • airhockeyjava.simulation.PuckSimulation

  • public class PuckSimulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which defines simulated puck behavior. Used by both the simulated detection/physics engine, and by the strategy engine for predicted where puck will be, in order to decide how to respond.
    Author:
    Joshua Segeren

    • Method Detail

      • updatePuckFromWallCollisions

        public static boolean updatePuckFromWallCollisions(Puck puck,
                                                   java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D tablePuckCollisionFrame,
                                                   float deltaTime)
        Static method to update puck state. Note the assumptions currently in place for the physical model: - Collision between puck and mallet do not affect the velocity/position of the mallet. Reference (billiard collisions i.e. 1st year physics): http://www.real-world-physics-problems.com/physics-of-billiards.html Note that this method DOES modify the passed puck object velocity and position based on wall reflections.
        Parameters:
        puck -
        tablePuckCollisionFrame -
        deltaTime -
        Returns:
        true iff collision handled

      • applyRestitutionToPuckVelocity

        private static void applyRestitutionToPuckVelocity(Puck puck,
                                                   float restitutionCoefficient)
        Apply some restitution (i.e. inelastic loss) to puck velocity following collision.
        Parameters:
        puck -
        restitutionCoefficient - The ratio of (relative speed after) / (relative speed before)
